title: Can't open HP website; get error message
content:
Every time I try to open an HP website -- hpsmart.com -- I get the error message below. I have to open the site using Safari (when I'm much prefer to use Firefox). Can you help me fix what's wrong?

BTW, I didn't understand the posting about security connection issues and my error message seems different than the ones highlighted in the article. _______________ An error has occurred invalidRequest X-request-id: a6547f80-e155-11ef-b409-| d532a6575ae7.db7795a0-ee4b-11ef-b409-| d532a6575ae7 Copy IDs to clipboard
creator: dlhig33

title: No sound on Youtube only with Firefox browser. Other browsers are OK.

title: Google Voice dial pad and latest Firefox 135.0.1 64-bit
content:
Can no longer use Google Voice in second half of a normal 8-5 work day, it appears. No amount of rebooting/restarting, closing browser, clearing caches, removing temp files, etc. appears to affect the issue. Turning off Enhanced Protection doesn't help. Issue is that I can dial a number, call connects, I can hang a call up, but the dial pad becomes unresponsive during the call. Using keyboard numbers vs. clicking the dial pad numbers makes no difference; no response either way. This happens with normal local calls, MS Teams calls from New York & other places for work, all of them. But, again, seems to happen after noon/lunch time. Very odd. The latter was why I thought it was more than 1 tab open, system resources, temp files, RAM allocation, etc. Happens whether I have only Google Voice open in 1 tab, have multiple tabs running alongside it, doesn't seem to matter.

Very perplexed. I shifted away from Brave to use FF for Google Voice & now the situation is reversed. Now, I can normally open Brave when this happens & get a responsive dial pad in Google Voice.

Using Windows 10 Professional, 64-bit on a big powerful workstation replacement category notebook.
creator: doug135

title: Privacy and Safety
content: Hello I have Privacy Badger, NoScript, UBlock and Duckduckgo Privacy Essentials, all of which are functional as soon as I install them. I also have Ghostery which demands that I click on it to activate it. Ghostery has had a reputation of reverting settings to default after you have changed the settings to your preference. I reported this to you before and they gave the semblance of acquiescing to your safety standards. What information are they now collecting by asking me to click to activate?
creator: de-nouement

title: Easy Youtube video downloader express
content: Non capisco come si usa Easy Youtube video downloader express, il mio sistema operativo è windows 7 pro, sarei infinitamente grato se qualcuno potesse aiutarmi step by step (sono anzianotto :)

title: Can't see msn.com when I open firefox

title: the failing FireFox
content: Dear Support I have opted to use the Firefox browser mainly due to the provision of fixed “Bookmarks” on the left-hand side of the screen, not provided by others. I have now learnt that when FireFox goes down due to one of the above issues, I have to switch to Google Chrome for access to the relevant pages and generally the WWW. I have no option but to abandon the failing FireFox, if the failures continue. Thanks Harry Elm London

title: Firefox not downloading unless I disable the "Ask where to save"
content:
For some time now, whenever I would try to download any kind of file from the web, it wouldn't do anything and it would just show a .part file in the downloads folder. The same type of file (i.e. jpg) would be able to be downloaded from certain sites but not from others.

At one point I though it might be an OS problem, but the issue wouldn't be replicated in other browsers (Chrome/Safari)

Recently, I tried once more fixing this and by disabling the "Always ask where to save" I was able to download anything from anywhere again, but only to the downloads folder.

System: Mac Studio / Apple M2 ultra chip / macOS 14.6.1

title: Refresh
content: After the last update of Firefox or perhaps Windows or perhaps a combo, all my pages demand me to login again. That’s fine but usually I do it once until the next updates and usually never at all. One page demanded I post a comment as a guest even though I was logged in with my account. I cleared the cache and cookies for that site and later for the whole cache etc. I checked the settings and for some reason “clear history when Firefox closes” was checked. WHY?? I love my history and would never do that… I unchecked it and restarted Firefox and my laptop. The same bug still happens for some websites. For example: I use WeatherCloud for my home station and I reload the page in the morning to update the “date” setting. That page made me login in again and never did once before in 2 years. My bank did the same thing.

content: Hi, in windows 10, while I am launching Firefox - if it does not exist yet - a new read-only file is created on the Desktop. Tryied to change the rights of that file, to reinstall completly FF, nothing seems to be useful. Possible way to solve it : I clean up my C: last week because I wanted more space and a better organization (moment from which that problem began). It is like Firefox was needing a file in the Windows tree and as he couldn't find it, he creates it because he need that this file exists. Regards

title: Unable clear non-containerised cookies
content:
I use containers to segregate cookies amongst specific groups as I desire, further, I use the Mozilla Multi-Account Containers extension so i can sync these containers across devices and clear cookies for individual containers. Unfortunately, there doesn't appear to be any way for me to clear the cookies of all my non-containerised browsing. In Firefox settings, I can clearly see that I can clear ALL my data, but I only want the data that has been used when I select "No container" for a new tab to be cleared. I am unsure if this is a missing feature or I am just unable to find it.

In the images provided you can see that you can manage your containers with this add-on and clear the storage and cookies for individual containers, however, this list lacks the "No Container" (which I guess is a container of its own) and the general firefox clear storage and cookies menu clears everything, including my containerised storage and cookies.

I would like to limit the number of processes running during a Firefox session. Task Manager shows 7 Processes running when only one tab is open.

Am I missing something here. It seems to be loading down my PC.
creator: tgrocki3

title: Firefox Multi-Account Containers keeps logging out of Facebook and Instagram
content:
I have the Firefox Multi-Account Containers extensions installed, and configured with 3 containers: one for YouTube, other for Amazon, and finally one for Facebook and Instagram. Each container only opens said website and also logs-in to said website. I also have another computer with Firefox which all of those settings are also synced.

Both Amazon and Facebook work perfectly, but the Facebook container constantly logs out both from Facebook and Instagram, prompting me to enter my credentials time and time again, which has reached to the extent that now Facebook presents a Captcha every login, alongside a prompt asking me if I want to save those login credentials (which I say yes).

This started to happen last week as I did a fresh install of my OS on my desktop rig after I logged in into my Firefox Sync account and configured the Firefox Multi-Account Containers extension. And yes, I have disabled erasing cookies after I close Firefox, Allow cookies and site data, and added both Instagram and Facebook as explicit options to save those cookies.
creator: MasterGeek.MX

title: AMEX Infection in Address Bar
content: I like to be able to type a single letter into the address bar and go to a website based on previous history. For example I type 's' and speedtest.net pops up. I'd like to type 'g' and get google like I used to. Now, instead, global.americanesxpress.com auto-populates and cannot be "removed from history". I have disabled anything with the word suggest. I've unchecked everything under Address Bar except Browsing History and nothing removes this offensive site from the url bar. So I disabled Browsing history and just type the full URL. Is there any way to remove this site or is it now a part of the browser itself?
